text:
When running ant from build.sh on a host with a pre-existing ant install the ant
shell script uses /usr/local/share/ant/lib class libraries.  It should be
overridden to use bootstrap/lib class libraries.
creator: tatar@anl.gov
alexeys@inventigo.com
text:
You will need to set ANT_HOME and JAVA_HOME manually for your installation.
Please also unset CLASSPATH.

When upgrading from a ant 1.5.2  Running ant from build.sh, I got the following
error when ant tried to install itself.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/apache/tools/ant/launch/Launcher

ant was looking at /usr/share/ant/lib which had 1.5.2 class libraries not the
1.6.5 class libraries which were needed for the build.
creator: tatar@anl.gov
peterreilly@apache.org
text:
This is due to the ant script
file calling /etc/ant.conf
/etc/ant.conf (at least on some systems)
overwrites ANT_HOME.
I have added a warning if this takes place.
(in ant 1.7 shortly)
The solution is to run ant with -noconfig.
This tells ant not to call /etc/ant.conf,
~/.ant/ant.conf and ~/.antrc.

Marking as WONTFIX as I am not
too sure that we can change the behaviour
without breaking things.
